content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

The tables below show data for two island nations, Eastland and Southland.

 <math alttext="$500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="125" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) Calculate each of the following for Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.(i) Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mtext>GDP</mtext></mstyle></math> per capita for Eastland(ii) Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mtext>GDP</mtext></mstyle></math> per capita for Southland

(b) If Eastland and Southland have the same velocity of money in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which nation must have the higher money supply in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Explain.

(c) Calculate each of the following in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.(i) The inflation rate in Eastland(ii) The inflation rate in Southland

(d) Based on your answer to part (c), if the nominal interest rate is the same for both nations in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which nation experiences the higher real interest rate in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Explain.

(e) Southland produces consumer goods and capital goods. While maintaining full employment, Southland decides to allocate fewer resources to the production of consumer goods. What will be the effect on the long-run economic growth rate in Southland? Explain.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

unit.text: 2: Economic Indicators and the Business Cycle

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
